metadata.key_specifications: Single 2-input AND gate, 1.65 V to 5.5 V supply voltage range, high noise immunity, ±24 mA output drive at 3.0 V, low power CMOS, TTL compatible, overvoltage tolerant inputs up to 5.5 V, partial power-down mode, latch-up performance ≤ 250 mA
metadata.applications: Translator in mixed 3.3 V and 5 V applications

page_summaries.content:
The 74LVC1G08 is a single 2-input AND gate. Inputs can be driven from either 3.3 V or 5 V devices. This feature allows the use of these devices as translators in mixed 3.3 V and 5 V applications.

Schmitt trigger action at all inputs makes the circuit tolerant of slower input rise and fall time. This device is fully specified for partial power-down applications using IOFF. The IOFF circuitry disables the output, preventing the damaging backflow current through the device when it is powered down.

• Wide supply voltage range from 1.65 V to 5.5 V
• High noise immunity
• ±24 mA output drive (VCC = 3.0 V)
• CMOS low power dissipation
• Direct interface with TTL levels
• Overvoltage tolerant inputs to 5.5 V
• IOFF circuitry provides partial Power-down mode operation
• Latch-up performance ≤ 250 mA

Product Summary.content: The 74LVC1G08 is a single 2-input AND gate with inputs that can be driven from either 3.3 V or 5 V devices, allowing its use as a translator in mixed 3.3 V and 5 V applications.

The device features Schmitt trigger action at all inputs for tolerance to slower input rise and fall times, and has IOFF circuitry that disables the output during power-down to prevent backflow current.

Key features include a wide supply voltage range from 1.65 V to 5.5 V, high noise immunity, ±24 mA output drive at 3.0 V, low power CMOS dissipation, direct TTL level interface, overvoltage tolerant inputs up to 5.5 V, partial Power-down mode operation with IOFF circuitry, and latch-up performance up to 250 mA.

The 74LVC1G08 is a single 2-input AND gate with Schmitt trigger inputs, IOFF power-down circuitry, wide supply range from 1.65 V to 5.5 V, high noise immunity, TTL compatibility, and low power CMOS operation.

Electrical Characteristics.content: Test data is given in Table 10. Definitions for test circuit: RL = Load resistance; CL = Load capacitance including jig and probe capacitance; RT = Termination resistance should be equal to the output impedance Zo of the pulse generator; VEXT = External voltage for measuring switching times.

Table 10 provides test data for different supply voltages (VCC), input voltages (VI), rise and fall times (tr, tf), load capacitances (CL), load resistances (RL), and external voltages (VEXT) for measuring propagation delays (tPLH, tPHL).
For supply voltages from 1.65 V to 1.95 V, the input voltage is VCC, rise and fall times are ≤ 2.0 ns, CL = 30 pF, RL = 1 kΩ, and VEXT is open.
For supply voltages from 2.3 V to 2.7 V, the input voltage is VCC, rise and fall times are ≤ 2.0 ns, CL = 30 pF, RL = 500 Ω, and VEXT is open.
For supply voltages from 2.7 V to 5.5 V, the input voltage is 2.7 V, rise and fall times are ≤ 2.5 ns, CL = 50 pF, RL = 500 Ω, and VEXT is open.

These lines describe the XSON6 package type, which is an extremely thin small outline package with no leads and 6 terminals. The body dimensions for different XSON6 variants (SOT886, SOT1115, and SOT1202) are provided.

Fig. 11. Package outline SOT1226-3 (X2SON5). Fig. 12. Package outline SOT8065-1 (XSON5). These figures illustrate the package outlines for X2SON5 and XSON5 package types, providing visual representations of the package dimensions and pin configurations.

The text covers various package types, including TSSOP5, SC-74A, XSON6 (with different body dimensions), X2SON5, and XSON5. It provides package outline figures, package descriptions, terminal counts, and body dimensions for these package types, which are essential information for understanding the packaging and physical characteristics of electronic components.
